results.title: Power to serve
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn and Athos Film Productions
results.brief_description: The significance of power as a servant of the British industrial community. Explains how scientific understanding and technological skills are utilised and deployed in the manufacture of different power units; concentrates on engines and hows something of the research and testing undertaken before quantity production can commence.

results.title: Power progress, 1951
results.brief_description: A report on progress being made in the building of dams and power stations as part of an extensive project to increase hydro-electric output in New Zealand. The latter part of the film shows experiments on the utilization of geo-thermal energy from the country’s many geysers.

results.title: Power on the farm
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the advantages which electrical power supply offers to those living in rural areas. On poultry farms, dairy farms, and small mixed farms, electricity can prove an excellent time and labour saver, both for the farmer and his wife.

results.title: Power of the market
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Eben Wilson and Rose Friedman
results.brief_description: First in a ten part series in which economist Milton Friedman expounds his views on various aspects of the market economy. In this film Friedman examines economic freedom as it operates in America and Hong Kong, and the individual freedom that results from it.

results.title: Power of stories
results.brief_description: Using outstanding picture books as a springboard for discussion, this Australian film examines the importance of literature in children’s educational, artistic and intellectual growth. Children, parents, teachers, librarians and childcare personnel discuss their opinions. Noni Hazlehurst is featured reading from “John Brown, Rose and the Midnight Cat”.

results.title: Power of speech [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, BBC and Eurfron Gwynne Jones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Discusses the early development of speech in children. Part three of the series considers the development of speech through the use of words. This is partly innate and partly due to training. Includes the problem of the late talking child, and discusses how it can be managed, based on the current ideas of language development.

results.title: Power of speech (TEFC) (colour)
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, BBC and Eurfron Gwynne Jones
results.brief_description: The development of language depends on the growth of the muscles and nerves necessary for making words, but also on training. A child who has never heard language will never learn to speak. The problem of the late talking child may lie in the fact that he has not been spoken to in the correct way.

results.title: Power in society: San Francisco bay area rapid transit winning public support
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Looks at the setting up of a rapid transit system in San Francisco and the actions of the various county councils involved. Examines the roles of individuals within these organizations, their interactions and different levels of power and influence in participating in this scheme.
